item.title: Young Phillies fan is gifted swag after adult fan takes his home run ball
item.description: A boy in the stands of a Philadelphia Phillies game thought he'd scored a baseball hit by Phillies outfielder Harrison Bader, until another fan insisted the ball was hers.

item.title: Jim Jarmusch's 'Father Mother Sister Brother' wins top prize at Venice Film Festival
item.description: Jim Jarmusch's quietly humorous relationship triptych won the top prize on Saturday. The film about the relationships between siblings, and with their parents, stars Adam Driver, Vicky Krieps and Cate Blanchett.

item.title: ICE arrests at a Georgia Hyundai plant create new tension with South Korea

item.title: Davey Johnson, who won 2 World Series with Orioles, managed Mets to title, dies at 82
item.description: Davey Johnson, an All-Star second baseman who won the World Series twice with the Baltimore Orioles as a player and managed the New York Mets to the title in 1986, died Friday.

item.title: Ken Dryden, Hall of Fame goalie for the Montreal Canadiens, dies at age 78
item.description: Dryden backstopped the NHL's most successful franchise to championships in six of his eight seasons in the league from 1970-71 to '78-79. He died after a fight with cancer.

item.title: Opinion: Susan Stamberg, trailblazer and NPR Founding Mother, retires
item.description: NPR Founding Mother Susan Stamberg is retiring. She became the first woman to anchor a nightly national news program in 1972, and helped loosen up the serious, stodgy sound of radio hosts.
